timeline.message: The BBKeyValue also can be optimized

timeline.bodyText: Just call this() the next constructor
timeline.author: anoopsjohn

replies.bodyText: I tried this actually but from the this() constructor calling the super.getRowLength is not allowed. Hence I went with this simple way.
replies.author: ramkrish86

timeline.bodyText: Its ok not to get here but leave that to be decoded within SizeCachedKeyValue.  So we can remove this TODO  IMO
timeline.author: anoopsjohn

timeline.bodyText: Whats the adv of decode rowLen here than in setKey()?  If the rowLen was already decoded for some other reason ya make sense to pass it than recalc later. But here am not fully sure
timeline.author: anoopsjohn

replies.bodyText: IMO the rowLen is anyway getting decoded in the setKey method. And the same we can reuse and have it for rowLen. So I think it is better to have it decoded earlier. Because that rowLen decoding is happening per cell.
replies.author: ramkrish86

replies.bodyText:
I see how the usage is helpful.  While seek to a key within the seek while loop, we decode and keep the state of rowLen. Once seek is done and called getCell() there we dont have to decode again but reuse the saved state. make sense.  Though I have a comment.
Use BB#getShortAfterPosition() instead of having extra logic here.  that will be even perf wise better both in MBB and SBB
replies.author: anoopsjohn

replies.bodyText:
Use BB#getShortAfterPosition() instead of having extra logic here. that will be even perf wise better both in MBB and SBB
You mean instead of getByteAfterPosition getting called 2 times just use getShortAfterPosition()?
replies.author: ramkrish86

timeline.bodyText: Ya here also as currKeyLen is already calculated we can pass.. But let rowLen be decoded within SizeCachedKeyValue only.  We can avoid all these changes
timeline.author: anoopsjohn

replies.bodyText: Here too the rowLen is already there. Any specific reason you feel this need not be decoded.
replies.author: ramkrish86

replies.bodyText: Any advantage we get because of doing here?  Because in one place, while constructing this KV objects, we decode the value and set as a state var and pass in constructor.  For keyLen, ya we already decoded there (before this patch) we pass that for reuse.  But for rowLen its not that way na..  So why to change the critical part of HFile reader adding new byte[] state? Better avoid.
replies.author: anoopsjohn

replies.bodyText: If you see my previous commit - I got the rowLen also in blockSeek and the readKeyValue() method to pass it to the SizeCachedKV variants. That was mainly just to ensure that we get rowLen while doing the KV parsing itself rather than KV creation. Now in the last commit since I was already doing that rowLen related change I changed the BBKV also so that we don't need to parse it there.
replies.author: ramkrish86

replies.bodyText:
So why to change the critical part of HFile reader adding new byte[] state


Sorry. When you mean byte[] state - are you saying we are adding a new byte[] as state variable?
replies.author: ramkrish86

replies.bodyText: Sorry not rowKey... Ya new rowLen state. My bad.  What is the real adv of this rowLen decoding happening at the Reader class?(and set to a state var)
replies.author: anoopsjohn

timeline.message: Fixing checkstyle and spot bugs comments
Minor updates make the rowLen as short and some consturctor formatting
Change two more places where there was a cast

timeline.bodyText: double-checking -- no need to consider the instance variables for equals and hashCode ?
timeline.author: ndimiduk

replies.bodyText: Actually not needed it is basically for the spot bugs report we had to add that.
replies.author: ramkrish86
